1 /*!
  2  * Hasher <http://github.com/millermedeiros/Hasher>
  3  * Includes: millermedeiros.EventDispatcher (0.8.2), millermedeiros.queryUtils (0.8.2), millermedeiros.event-listenerFacade (0.3)
  4  * @author Miller Medeiros <http://www.millermedeiros.com/>
  5  * @version 0.9.7 (2010/11/01)
  6  * Released under the MIT License <http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php>
  7  */
  8 (function(window, document){
  9 /*
 10  * Miller Medeiros JS Library
 11  * @author Miller Medeiros
 12  * @version 0.1.1 (2010/11/01)
 13  * Released under the MIT License <http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php>
 14  */
 15  
 16 /**
 17  * @namespace Miller Medeiros Namespace
 18  * @name millermedeiros
 19  */
 20 var millermedeiros = window.millermedeiros = {};
 21 /**
 22  * EventDispatcher Object, used to allow Custom Objects to dispatch events.
 23  * @constructor
 24  * @author Miller Medeiros <http://www.millermedeiros.com/>
 25  * @version 0.8.2 (2010/08/26)
 26  * Released under the MIT License <http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php>
 27  */
 28 millermedeiros.EventDispatcher = function(){
 29 	/** 
 30 	 * Event Handlers
 31 	 * @type Object.<string, Array.<Function>>
 32 	 */
 33 	this._handlers = {};
 34 	
 35 	/**
 36 	 * Disabled Event Types (events types that shouldn't be dispatched)
 37 	 * @type Array.<string>
 38 	 */
 39 	this._disabled = [];
 40 };
 41 
 42 millermedeiros.EventDispatcher.prototype = {
 43 	
 44 	/**
 45 	 * Add Event Listener
 46 	 * @param {string} eType	Event Type.
 47 	 * @param {Function} fn	Event Handler.
 48 	 */
 49 	addEventListener : function(eType, fn){
 50 		if(typeof this._handlers[eType] == 'undefined'){
 51 			this._handlers[eType] = [];
 52 		}
 53 		this._handlers[eType].push(fn);
 54 	},
 55 	
 56 	/**
 57 	 * Remove Event Listener
 58 	 * @param {string} eType	Event Type.
 59 	 * @param {Function} fn	Event Handler.
 60 	 */
 61 	removeEventListener : function(eType, fn){
 62 		if(! this.hasEventListener(eType)){
 63 			return;
 64 		}
 65 		var	typeHandlers = this._handlers[eType], //stored for performance
 66 			n = typeHandlers.length;
 67 		if(n == 1){
 68 			delete this._handlers[eType];
 69 		}else{
 70 			while(n--){ //faster than for
 71 				if(typeHandlers[n] == fn){
 72 					typeHandlers.splice(n, 1);
 73 					break;
 74 				}
 75 			}
 76 		}
 77 	},
 78 	
 79 	/**
 80 	 * Removes all Listeners from the EventDispatcher object.
 81 	 * @param {(string|boolean)} eType	Event type or `true` if want to remove listeners of all event types.
 82 	 */
 83 	removeAllEventListeners : function(eType){
 84 		if(typeof eType === 'string' && this.hasEventListener(eType)){
 85 			delete this._handlers[eType];
 86 		}else if(eType){
 87 			this._handlers = {};
 88 		}
 89 	},
 90 	
 91 	/**
 92 	 * Checks if the EventDispatcher has any listeners registered for a specific type of event. 
 93 	 * @param {string} eType	Event Type.
 94 	 * @return {boolean}
 95 	 */
 96 	hasEventListener : function(eType){
 97 		return (typeof this._handlers[eType] != 'undefined');
 98 	},
 99 
100 	/**
101 	 * Dispatch Event
102 	 * - Call all Handlers Listening to the Event.
103 	 * @param {(Object|string)} evt	Custom Event Object (property `type` is required) or String with Event type.
104 	 * @return {boolean} If Event was successfully dispatched.
105 	 */
106 	dispatchEvent : function(evt){
107 		evt = (typeof evt == 'string')? {type: evt} : evt; //create Object if not an Object to always call handlers with same type of argument.
108 		if(this.hasEventListener(evt.type)){
109 			var typeHandlers = this._handlers[evt.type], //stored for performance
110 				curHandler,
111 				i,
112 				n = typeHandlers.length;
113 			evt.target = evt.target || this; //ensure Event.target exists
114 			for(i=0; i<n; i++){
115 				curHandler = typeHandlers[i];
116 				curHandler(evt);
117 			}
118 			return true;
119 		}
120 		return false;
121 	},
122 	
123 	/**
124 	 * Check if Event will be dispatched (i.e. If event type is enabled)
125 	 * @param {string} evtType	Event type.	
126 	 * @return {boolean} If Event will be dispatched.
127 	 */
128 	willDispatch : function(evtType){
129 		var n = this._disabled.length;
130 		while(n--){
131 			if(this._disabled[n] === evtType){
132 				return false;
133 			}
134 		}
135 		return true;
136 	},
137 	
138 	/**
139 	 * Disable Event dispatching by type
140 	 * @param {...string} evtTypes	Event types that should be disabled (events types that shouldn't be dispatched)
141 	 */
142 	disableEvent : function(evtTypes){
143 		var types = Array.prototype.slice.call(arguments, 0),
144 			n = types.length,
145 			curType;
146 		while(n--){
147 			curType = types[n];
148 			if(this.willDispatch(curType)){ //avoid adding multiple times
149 				this._disabled.push(curType);
150 			}
151 		}
152 	},
153 	
154 	/**
155 	 * Enable Event dispatching by type
156 	 * @param {...string} evtTypes	Event types that should be enabled (events types that should be dispatched)
157 	 */
158 	enableEvent : function(evtTypes){
159 		var types = Array.prototype.slice.call(arguments, 0),
160 			n = types.length,
161 			m,
162 			curType;
163 		while(n--){
164 			curType = types[n];
165 			m = this._disabled.length;
166 			while(m--){
167 				if(this._disabled[m] === curType){
168 					this._disabled.splice(m, 1);
169 				}
170 			}
171 		}
172 	}
173 	
174 };
175 (function(window, millermedeiros){
176 	
177 	var location = window.location; //local storage for better minification
178 
179 	/**
180 	 * @namespace Utilities for query string manipulation.
181 	 * @author Miller Medeiros <http://www.millermedeiros.com/>
182 	 * @version 0.8.3 (2010/11/01)
183 	 * Released under the MIT License <http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php>
184 	 */
185 	millermedeiros.queryUtils = {
186 		
187 		/**
188 		 * Gets full query as string with all special chars decoded.
189 		 * @param {string} [url]	 URL to be parsed, defaults to `location.href`
190 		 * @return {string}	Query string
191 		 */
192 		getQueryString : function(url){
193 			url = url || location.href; //used location.href to avoid bug on IE6 and pseudo query string inside location.hash
194 			url = url.replace(/#[\w\W]*/, ''); //removes hash (to avoid getting hash query)
195 			var queryString = /\?[a-zA-Z0-9\=\&\%\$\-\_\.\+\!\*\'\(\)\,]+/.exec(url); //valid chars according to: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc1738.txt
196 			return (queryString)? decodeURIComponent(queryString[0]) : '';
197 		},
198 		
199 		/**
200 		 * Gets query as Object.
201 		 * - Alias for `millermedeiros.queryUtils.toQueryObject( millermedeiros.queryUtils.getQueryString(url) )`
202 		 * @param {string} [url]	URL to be parsed, default to location.href.
203 		 * @return {Object.<string, (string|number)>}	Object with all the query "params => values" pairs.
204 		 */
205 		getQueryObject : function(url){
206 			return this.toQueryObject(this.getQueryString(url));
207 		},
208 		
209 		/**
210 		 * Convert Query String into an Object
211 		 * @param {string} queryString	 Query String to be parsed
212 		 * @return {Object.<string, (string|number)>}	Object with all the query "params => values" pairs.
213 		 */
214 		toQueryObject : function(queryString){
215 			var queryArr = queryString.replace('?', '').split('&'), 
216 				n = queryArr.length,
217 				queryObj = {},
218 				value;
219 			while (n--) {
220 				queryArr[n] = queryArr[n].split('=');
221 				value = queryArr[n][1];
222 				queryObj[queryArr[n][0]] = isNaN(value)? value : parseFloat(value);
223 			}
224 			return queryObj;
225 		},
226 		
227 		/**
228 		 * Get query parameter value.
229 		 * @param {string} param	Parameter name.
230 		 * @param {string} [url]	URL to be parsed, default to location.href
231 		 * @return {(string|number)}	Parameter value.
232 		 */
233 		getParamValue : function(param, url){
234 			url = url || location.href;
235 			var regexp = new RegExp('(\\?|&)'+ param + '=([^&]*)'), //matches `?param=value` or `¶m=value`, value = $2
236 				result = regexp.exec(url),
237 				value = (result && result[2])? result[2] : null;
238 			return isNaN(value)? value : parseFloat(value);
239 		},
240 		
241 		/**
242 		 * Checks if query contains parameter.
243 		 * @param {string} param	Parameter name.
244 		 * @param {string} [url]	URL to be parsed, default to location.href
245 		 * @return {boolean} If parameter exist.
246 		 */
247 		hasParam : function(param, url){
248 			var regexp = new RegExp('(\\?|&)'+ param +'=', 'g'); //matches `?param=` or `¶m=`
249 			return regexp.test(this.getQueryString(url));
250 		},
251 		
252 		/**
253 		 * Converts object into query string.
254 		 * @param {Object} obj	Object with "params => values" pairs.
255 		 * @return {string}	Formated query string starting with '?'.
256 		 */
257 		toQueryString : function(obj){
258 			var query = [],
259 				param;
260 			for(param in obj){
261 				if(obj.hasOwnProperty(param)){ //avoid copying properties from the prototype
262 					query.push(param +'='+ obj[param]);
263 				}
264 			}
265 			return (query.length)? '?'+ query.join('&') : '';
266 		}
267 		
268 	};
269 
270 }(window, millermedeiros));
271 /*
272  * millermedeiros.event - DOM Event Listener Facade
273  * - Cross-browser DOM Event Listener attachment/detachment.
274  * - Based on Peter-Paul Koch addEventSimple <http://www.quirksmode.org/js/eventSimple.html>
275  * @author Miller Medeiros <http://www.millermedeiros.com/>
276  * @version 0.3 (2010/06/23)
277  * Released under the MIT License <http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php>
278  */
279 
280 /**
281  * @namespace Utilities for Browser Native Events
282  */
283 millermedeiros.event = millermedeiros.event || {};
284 
285 /**
286 * Adds DOM Event Listener
287 * @param {Element} elm Element.
288 * @param {string} eType Event type.
289 * @param {Function} fn Listener function.
290 */
291 millermedeiros.event.addListener = function(elm, eType, fn){
292 	if(elm.addEventListener){
293 		elm.addEventListener(eType, fn, false);
294 	}else if(elm.attachEvent){
295 		elm.attachEvent('on' + eType, fn);
296 	}else{
297 		elm['on' + eType] = fn;
298 	}
299 };
300 
301 /**
302 * Removes DOM Event Listener
303 * @param {Element} elm Element.
304 * @param {string} eType Event type.
305 * @param {Function} fn Listener function.
306 */
307 millermedeiros.event.removeListener = function(elm, eType, fn){
308 	if(elm.removeEventListener){
309 		elm.removeEventListener(eType, fn, false);
310 	}else if(elm.detachEvent){
311 		elm.detachEvent('on' + eType, fn);
312 	}else{
313 		elm['on' + eType] = null;
314 	}
315 };
316 }(window, window.document));
317 /*
318  * Hasher Event
319  * @author Miller Medeiros <http://www.millermedeiros.com/>
320  * @version 0.3 (2010/11/01)
321  * Released under the MIT License <http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php>
322  */
323 (function(window){
324 	
325 	//--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
326 	// Constructor
327 	//--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
328 	
329 	/**
330 	 * HasherEvent Object.
331 	 * <p>According to the HTML5 spec `hashchange` event should have `oldURL` and `newURL` properties, since the only portion of the URL that changes is the hash I decided to use `oldHash` and `newHash` instead. (http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/multipage/history.html#event-hashchange)</p>
332 	 * @param {string} eType	Hasher Event type.
333 	 * @param {(string|null)} oldHash	Previous Hash.
334 	 * @param {(string|null)} newHash	Current Hash.
335 	 * @constructor
336 	 * @name HasherEvent
337 	 */
338 	var HasherEvent = window.HasherEvent = function(eType, oldHash, newHash){
339 		/**
340 		 * Event Type
341 		 * @type string
342 		 */
343 		this.type = eType;
344 		/**
345 		 * Previous Hash value
346 		 * @type (string|null)
347 		 */
348 		this.oldHash = oldHash;
349 		/**
350 		 * Current Hash value
351 		 * @type (string|null)
352 		 */
353 		this.newHash = newHash;
354 	};
355 	
356 	//--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
357 	// Methods
358 	//--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
359 	
360 	/**
361 	 * Returns string representation of the HasherEvent
362 	 * @return {string} A string representation of the object.
363 	 */
364 	HasherEvent.prototype.toString = function(){
365 		return '[HasherEvent type="'+ this.type +'" oldHash="'+ this.oldHash +'" newHash="'+ this.newHash +'"]';
366 	};
367 	
368 	//--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
369 	// Constants
370 	//--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
371 	
372 	/**
373 	 * Defines the value of the type property of an change event object.
374 	 * @type string
375 	 * @constant
376 	 */
377 	HasherEvent.CHANGE = 'change';
378 	
379 	 /**
380 	 * Defines the value of the type property of an init event object.
381 	 * @type string
382 	 * @constant
383 	 */
384 	HasherEvent.INIT = 'init';
385 	
386 	/**
387 	 * Defines the value of the type property of an stop event object.
388 	 * @type string
389 	 * @constant
390 	 */
391 	HasherEvent.STOP = 'stop';
392 	
393 }(window));
394 /*
395  * Hasher
396  * - History Manager for rich-media applications.
397  * @author Miller Medeiros <http://www.millermedeiros.com/>
398  * @version 0.9.6 (2010/11/01)
399  * Released under the MIT License <http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php>
400  */
401 (function(window, document){
402 	
403 	//--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
404 	// Private Vars
405 	//--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
406 	
407 	var 
408 		
409 		//--- local storage for brevity, performance improvement and better compression ---//
410 		
411 		/** @private {Location} */
412 		location = window.location,
413 		
414 		/** @private {History} */
415 		history = window.history,
416 		
417 		/** @private {HasherEvent} */
418 		HasherEvent = window.HasherEvent,
419 		
420 		/** @private {millermedeiros} */
421 		millermedeiros = window.millermedeiros,
422 		
423 		/** @private {millermedeiros.EventDispatcher} @extends millermedeiros.EventDispatcher */
424 		Hasher = new millermedeiros.EventDispatcher(),
425 		
426 		/** @private {millermedeiros.queryUtils} Utilities for query string manipulation */
427 		_queryUtils = millermedeiros.queryUtils,
428 		
429 		/** @private {millermedeiros.event} Browser native events facade */
430 		_eventFacade = millermedeiros.event,
431 		
432 		
433 		//--- local vars ---//
434 		
435 		/** @private {string} previous/current hash value */
436 		_hash, 
437 		
438 		/** @private {number} stores setInterval reference (used to check if hash changed on non-standard browsers) */
439 		_checkInterval,
440 		
441 		/** @private {boolean} If Hasher is active and should listen/dispatch changes on the window location hash */
442 		_isActive,
443 		
444 		/** @private {Element} iframe used for IE <= 7 */
445 		_frame,
446 		
447 		
448 		//--- sniffing/feature detection ---//
449 		
450 		/** @private {string} User Agent */
451 		_UA = navigator.userAgent,
452 		
453 		/** @private {boolean} if is IE */
454 		_isIE = /MSIE/.test(_UA) && (!window.opera),
455 		
456 		/** @private {boolean} If browser supports the `hashchange` event - FF3.6+, IE8+, Chrome 5+, Safari 5+ */
457 		_isHashChangeSupported = ('onhashchange' in window),
458 		
459 		/** @private {boolean} if is IE <= 7 */
460 		_isLegacyIE = _isIE && !_isHashChangeSupported, //check if is IE6-7 since hash change is only supported on IE8+ and changing hash value on IE6-7 doesn't generate history record.
461 		
462 		/** @private {boolean} If it is a local file */
463 		_isLocal = (location.protocol === 'file:');
464 	
465 	
466 	//--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
467 	// Private Methods
468 	//--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
469 	
470 	/**
471 	 * Remove `Hasher.prependHash` and `Hasher.appendHash` from hashValue
472 	 * @param {string} hash	Hash value
473 	 * @private
474 	 */
475 	function _trimHash(hash){
476 		var regexp = new RegExp('^\\'+ Hasher.prependHash +'|\\'+ Hasher.appendHash +'$', 'g'); //match appendHash and prependHash
477 		return hash.replace(regexp, '');
478 	}
479 	
480 	/**
481 	 * Get hash value stored inside iframe
482 	 * - used for IE <= 7. [HACK] 
483 	 * @return {string}	Hash value without '#'.
484 	 * @private
485 	 */
486 	function _getFrameHash(){
487 		return (_frame)? _frame.contentWindow.frameHash : null;
488 	}
489 	
490 	/**
491 	 * Update iframe content, generating a history record and saving current hash/title on IE <= 7. [HACK]
492 	 * - based on Really Simple History, SWFAddress and YUI.history solutions.
493 	 * @param {(string|null)} hashValue	Hash value without '#'.
494 	 * @private
495 	 */
496 	function _updateFrame(hashValue){
497 		if(_frame && hashValue != _getFrameHash()){
498 			var frameDoc = _frame.contentWindow.document;
499 			frameDoc.open();
500 			frameDoc.write('<html><head><title>' + Hasher.getTitle() + '</title><script type="text/javascript">var frameHash="' + hashValue + '";</script></head><body> </body></html>'); //stores current hash inside iframe.
501 			frameDoc.close();
502 		}
503 	}
504 	
505 	/**
506 	 * Stores new hash value and dispatch `HasherEvent.CHANGE` if Hasher is "active".
507 	 * @param {string} newHash	New Hash Value.
508 	 * @private
509 	 */
510 	function _registerChange(newHash){
511 		newHash = decodeURIComponent(newHash); //fix IE8 while offline
512 		if(_hash != newHash){
513 			var oldHash = _hash;
514 			_hash = newHash; //should come before event dispatch to make sure user can get proper value inside event handler
515 			if(_isLegacyIE){
516 				_updateFrame(newHash);
517 			}
518 			Hasher.dispatchEvent(new HasherEvent(HasherEvent.CHANGE, _trimHash(oldHash), _trimHash(newHash)));
519 		}
520 	}
521 	
522 	/**
523 	 * Creates iframe used to record history state on IE <= 7. [HACK]
524 	 * @private
525 	 */
526 	function _createFrame(){
527 		_frame = document.createElement('iframe');
528 		_frame.src = 'about:blank';
529 		_frame.style.display = 'none';
530 		document.body.appendChild(_frame);
531 	}
532 	
533 	/**
534 	 * Get hash value from current URL
535 	 * @return {string}	Hash value without '#'.
536 	 * @private
537 	 */
538 	function _getWindowHash(){
539 		//parsed full URL instead of getting location.hash because Firefox decode hash value (and all the other browsers don't)
540 		//also because of IE8 bug with hash query in local file [issue #6]
541 		var result = /#(.*)$/.exec( Hasher.getURL() );
542 		return (result && result[1])? decodeURIComponent(result[1]) : '';
543 	}
544 	
545 	/**
546 	 * Checks if hash/history state has changed and dispatch HasherEvent.
547 	 * @private
548 	 */
549 	function _checkHistory(){
550 		var curHash = _getWindowHash();
551 		if(curHash != _hash){
552 			_registerChange(curHash);
553 		}
554 	}
555 	
556 	/**
557 	 * Check if browser history state has changed on IE <= 7. [HACK]
558 	 * - used since IE 6,7 doesn't generates new history record on hashchange.
559 	 * @private
560 	 */
561 	function _checkHistoryLegacyIE(){
562 		var windowHash = _getWindowHash(),
563 			frameHash = _getFrameHash();
564 		if(frameHash != _hash && frameHash != windowHash){ //detect changes made pressing browser history buttons. Workaround since history.back() and history.forward() doesn't update hash value on IE6/7 but updates content of the iframe.
565 			Hasher.setHash(frameHash);
566 		}else if(windowHash != _hash){ //detect if hash changed (manually or using setHash)
567 			_registerChange(windowHash);
568 		}
569 	}
570 	
571 	
572 	//--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
573 	// Public (API)
574 	//--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
575 	
576 	/**
577 	 * Hasher
578 	 * @namespace History Manager for rich-media applications.
579 	 * @extends millermedeiros.EventDispatcher
580 	 * @name Hasher
581 	 */
582 	window.Hasher = Hasher; //register Hasher to the global scope
583 	
584 	/**
585 	 * Hasher Version Number
586 	 * @type string
587 	 * @const
588 	 */
589 	Hasher.VERSION = '0.9.7';
590 	
591 	/**
592 	 * String that should always be added to the end of Hash value.
593 	 * <ul>
594 	 * <li>default value: '/';</li>
595 	 * <li>will be automatically removed from `Hasher.getHash()`</li>
596 	 * <li>avoid conflicts with elements that contain ID equal to hash value;</li>
597 	 * </ul>
598 	 * @type string
599 	 */
600 	Hasher.appendHash = '/';
601 	
602 	/**
603 	 * String that should always be added to the beginning of Hash value.
604 	 * <ul>
605 	 * <li>default value: '/';</li>
606 	 * <li>will be automatically removed from `Hasher.getHash()`</li>
607 	 * <li>avoid conflicts with elements that contain ID equal to hash value;</li>
608 	 * </ul>
609 	 * @type string
610 	 */
611 	Hasher.prependHash = '/';
612 	
613 	/**
614 	 * String used to split hash paths; used by `Hasher.getHashAsArray()` to split paths.
615 	 * <ul>
616 	 * <li>default value: '/';</li>
617 	 * </ul>
618 	 * @type string
619 	 */
620 	Hasher.separator = '/';
621 	
622 	/**
623 	 * Start listening/dispatching changes in the hash/history.
624 	 */
625 	Hasher.init = function(){
626 		if(_isActive){
627 			return;
628 		}
629 		
630 		var oldHash = _hash;
631 		_hash = _getWindowHash();
632 		
633 		//thought about branching/overloading Hasher.init() to avoid checking multiple times but don't think worth doing it since it probably won't be called multiple times. [?] 
634 		if(_isHashChangeSupported){
635 			_eventFacade.addListener(window, 'hashchange', _checkHistory);
636 		}else { 
637 			if(_isLegacyIE){
638 				if(!_frame){
639 					_createFrame();
640 					_updateFrame(_hash);
641 				}
642 				_checkInterval = setInterval(_checkHistoryLegacyIE, 25);
643 			}else{
644 				_checkInterval = setInterval(_checkHistory, 25);
645 			}
646 		}
647 		
648 		_isActive = true;
649 		this.dispatchEvent(new HasherEvent(HasherEvent.INIT, oldHash, _hash));
650 	};
651 	
652 	/**
653 	 * Stop listening/dispatching changes in the hash/history.
654 	 */
655 	Hasher.stop = function(){
656 		if(!_isActive){
657 			return;
658 		}
659 		
660 		if(_isHashChangeSupported){
661 			_eventFacade.removeListener(window, 'hashchange', _checkHistory);
662 		}else{
663 			clearInterval(_checkInterval);
664 			_checkInterval = null;
665 		}
666 		
667 		_isActive = false;
668 		this.dispatchEvent(new HasherEvent(HasherEvent.STOP, _hash, _hash)); //since it didn't changed oldHash and newHash should be the same. [?]
669 	};
670 	
671 	/**
672 	 * Retrieve full URL.
673 	 * @return {string}	Full URL.
674 	 */
675 	Hasher.getURL = function(){
676 		return location.href;
677 	};
678 	
679 	/**
680 	 * Retrieve URL without query string and hash.
681 	 * @return {string}	Base URL.
682 	 */
683 	Hasher.getBaseURL = function(){
684 		return this.getURL().replace(/(\?.*)|(\#.*)/, ''); //removes everything after '?' and/or '#'
685 	};
686 	
687 	/**
688 	 * Set Hash value.
689 	 * @param {string} value	Hash value without '#'.
690 	 */
691 	Hasher.setHash = function(value){
692 		value = (value)? this.prependHash + value.replace(/^\#/, '') + this.appendHash : value; //removes '#' from the beginning of string and append/prepend default values.
693 		if(value != _hash){
694 			_registerChange(value); //avoid breaking the application if for some reason `location.hash` don't change
695 			if(_isIE && _isLocal){
696 				value = value.replace(/\?/, '%3F'); //fix IE8 local file bug [issue #6]
697 			}
698 			location.hash = '#'+ encodeURI(value); //used encodeURI instead of encodeURIComponent to preserve '?', '/', '#'. Fixes Safari bug [issue #8]
699 		}
700 	};
701 	
702 	/**
703 	 * Return hash value as String.
704 	 * @return {string}	Hash value without '#'.
705 	 */
706 	Hasher.getHash = function(){
707 		//didn't used actual value of the `location.hash` to avoid breaking the application in case `location.hash` isn't available and also because value should always be synched.
708 		return _trimHash(_hash);
709 	};
710 	
711 	/**
712 	 * Return hash value as Array.	
713 	 * @return {Array.<string>}	Hash splitted into an Array.  
714 	 */
715 	Hasher.getHashAsArray = function(){
716 		return this.getHash().split(this.separator);
717 	};
718 	
719 	/**
720 	 * Get Query portion of the Hash as a String
721 	 * - alias to: `millermedeiros.queryUtils.getQueryString( Hasher.getHash() ).substr(1);`
722 	 * @return {string}	Hash Query without '?'
723 	 */
724 	Hasher.getHashQuery = function(){
725 		return _queryUtils.getQueryString( this.getHash() ).substr(1);
726 	};
727 	
728 	/**
729 	 * Get Query portion of the Hash as an Object
730 	 * - alias to: `millermedeiros.queryUtils.toQueryObject( Hasher.getHashQueryString() );`
731 	 * @return {Object} Hash Query
732 	 */
733 	Hasher.getHashQueryAsObject = function(){
734 		return _queryUtils.toQueryObject( this.getHashQuery() );
735 	};
736 	
737 	/**
738 	 * Get parameter value from the query portion of the Hash
739 	 * - alias to: `millermedeiros.queryUtils.getParamValue(paramName, Hasher.getHash() );`
740 	 * @param {string} paramName	Parameter Name.
741 	 * @return {string}	Parameter value.
742 	 */
743 	Hasher.getHashQueryParam = function(paramName){
744 		return _queryUtils.getParamValue(paramName, this.getHash() );
745 	};
746 	
747 	/**
748 	 * Set page title
749 	 * @param {string} value	Page Title
750 	 */
751 	Hasher.setTitle = function(value){
752 		document.title = value;
753 	};
754 	
755 	/**
756 	 * Get page title
757 	 * @return {string} Page Title
758 	 */
759 	Hasher.getTitle = function(){
760 		return document.title;
761 	};
762 	
763 	/**
764 	 * Navigate to previous page in history
765 	 */
766 	Hasher.back = function(){
767 		history.back();
768 	};
769 	
770 	/**
771 	 * Navigate to next page in history
772 	 */
773 	Hasher.forward = function(){
774 		history.forward();
775 	};
776 	
777 	/**
778 	 * Loads a page from the session history, identified by its relative location to the current page.
779 	 * - for example `-1` loads previous page, `1` loads next page.
780 	 * @param {int} delta	Relative location to the current page.
781 	 */
782 	Hasher.go = function(delta){
783 		history.go(delta);
784 	};
785 	
786 	/**
787 	 * Removes all event listeners, stops Hasher and destroy Hasher object.
788 	 * - IMPORTANT: Hasher won't work after calling this method, Hasher Object will be deleted.
789 	 */
790 	Hasher.dispose = function(){
791 		Hasher.removeAllEventListeners(true);
792 		Hasher.stop();
793 		_hash = _checkInterval = _isActive = _frame = _UA  = _isIE = _isLegacyIE = _isHashChangeSupported = _isLocal = _queryUtils = _eventFacade = Hasher = window.Hasher = null;
794 		//can't use `delete window.hasher;` because on IE it throws errors, `window` isn't actually an object, delete can only be used on Object properties.
795 	};
796 	
797 	/**
798 	 * Returns string representation of the Hasher object.
799 	 * @return {string} A string representation of the object.
800 	 */
801 	Hasher.toString = function(){
802 		return '[Hasher version="'+ this.VERSION +'" hash="'+ this.getHash() +'"]';
803 	};
804 	
805 }(window, window.document));
806
